  "Initiated By" : "TEXAS STATE SECURITIES BOARD",
  "Allegations" : "THE ENFORCEMENT DIVISION OF THE TEXAS SECURITIES BOARD FILED A NOTICE OF HEARING AGAINST NORMAN HOWARD SCHER (CRD 700301) ON NOVEMBER 27, 1996. THE NOTICE ALLEGES SEVEN GROUNDS BY WHICH SCHER SHOULD BE DENIED REGISTRATION, ALL RELATING TO HIS ALLEGED DESTRUCTION AND ALTERATION OF DOCUMENTS. SCHER WAS SUSPENDED AND FINED BY THE NEW YORK STOCK EXCHANGE ON JULY 1, 1996. THE HEARING IS SET FOR JANUARY 31, 1997. PLEASE CONTACT CHARLES NEAL AT (512) 305-8392 FOR MORE INFORMATION.",
  "Resolution" : "Settled",
  "SanctionDetails" : [ ],
  "Sanction Details" : "ON MARCH 24, 1997, THE STAFF AND OPPENHEIMER SETTLED THE CONTESTED CASE REGARDING THE APPLICATION OF NORMAN HOWARD SCHER FOR AGENT REGISTRATION IN TEXAS. THE HEARING ON WHICH HAD BEEN CONTINUED UNTIL APRIL 3-4, 1997. OPPENHEIMER WAS PERMITTED TO WITHDRAW SCHER'S APPLICATION AFTER ENTERING AN UNDERTAKING WITH THE SECURITIES COMMISSIONER NOT TO SUBMIT AN APPLICATION FOR SCHER'S REGISTRATION AGAIN FOR TWO YEARS FROM MARCH 21, 1997. NO REPRESENTATIONS WERE MADE REGARDING WHETHER HE WOULD BE REGISTERED AFTER THAT TIME IF HE REAPPLIED.",
  "Broker Comment" : "I SUBMITTED AN APPLICATION IN TEXAS TO SERVICE A CLIENT OF MINE FOR THE PAST 10 YEARS.  NOTWITHSTANDING THE FACT THAT THIS CLIENT WANTS ME TO BE HIS BROKER, HAS NEVER ONCE COMPLAINED OF MY SERVICES, AND THE NYSE ACTION IS COMPLETE AND ALL PENALTIES SATISFIED, TEXAS REFUSED MY APPLICATION.  GIVEN THAT MY CLIENT WANTS ME AS HIS BROKER, AND I HAVE SATISFIED ALL ASPECTS OF THE NYSE ACTION, I HAVE DECIDED TO CONTEST WHAT I RESPECTFULLY BELIEVE IS AN UNREASONABLE POSITION BY THE STATE OF TEXAS"
